sen.j: 御陵駅（みささぎえき）は、京都市山科区にある京都市交通局・京阪電気鉄道の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Misasagi Station is a railway station located in the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, which is jointly operated by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and the Keihan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 京都市交通局→Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau[http://www.city.kyoto.jp/html/kotsu/]
sen.e: Misasagi Station is a railway facility located in the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, which is jointly operated by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and the Keihan Electric Railway.
Misasagi Station is a railway facility located in the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, which is jointly operated by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and the Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 京都市交通局の管轄駅（京都市交通局と京阪電気鉄道の共同使用駅）である。
sen.e: It is operated under the jurisdiction of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (jointly used by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and the Keihan Electric Railway).
It is operated under the jurisdiction of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (jointly used by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and the Keihan Electric Railway).
It is operated under the jurisdiction of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (jointly used by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and the Keihan Electric Railway).

sen.j: 地下鉄東西線の駅番号はT08。
sen.e: Its Subway Tozai Line station number is T08.
Its Subway Tozai Line station number is T08.
Its Subway Tozai Line station number is T08.

sen.j: 「御陵」とは天皇の墓所のことで、この地名は駅の東300mほどに天智天皇山科陵があることに由来する。
sen.e: "Misasagi" originally referred to an emperor's graveyard and the area around the station is known by that name due to the fact that the Imperial Tomb of Emperor Tenji is located about 300 meters to the north of the station.
sen.cmt: 天智天皇山科陵→Imperial Tomb of Emperor Tenji[http://www.city.kyoto.lg.jp/kotsu/cmsfiles/contents/0000056/56475/eriaMAP-25P-26P.pdf を参照しました]
sen.e: "Misasagi" originally referred to an emperor's graveyard, and the area around the station is known by that name due to the fact that the Imperial Tomb of Emperor Tenji is located approximately 300 meters north of the station.

Misasagi' originally referred to an emperor's graveyard, and the area around the station is known by that name due to the fact that the Imperial Tomb of Emperor Tenchi is located approximately 300 meters north of the station.
sen.cmt: Tenji→ Tenchi としました。" → ' としました。

sen.j: 京都市交通局
sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau
Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄東西線
sen.e: Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line
Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line
Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 京阪京津線 ※起点駅であるが、原則全列車が地下鉄東西線に直通する
sen.e: While the Keihan Keishin Line* officially starts at Misasagi Station, all trains that depart from this station normally connect directly to the Subway Tozai Line.
The Keihan Keishin Line * officially starts at Misasagi Station, but all trains that depart from this station normally connect directly to the Subway Tozai Line.
The Keihan Keishin Line * officially starts at Misasagi Station, but all trains that depart from this station normally connect directly to the Subway Tozai Line.

sen.j: 京阪京津線の乗り入れの接続駅で、地下2層が西行き（蹴上駅方面）、地下3層が東行き（山科駅方面）のホームとなっている。
sen.e: Misasagi Station, a junction station to the Keihan Keishin Line, has a platform for westbound trains (for Keage Station) on the second basement level and a platform for eastbound trains (for Yamashina Station) on the third basement level.

Misasagi Station, a junction station to the Keihan Keishin Line, has a platform for westbound trains (for Keage Station) on the second basement level and a platform for eastbound trains (for Yamashina Station) on the third basement level.

Misasagi Station, a junction station to the Keihan Keishin Line, has a platform for westbound trains (for Keage Station) on the second basement level and a platform for eastbound trains (for Yamashina Station) on the third basement level.

sen.j: ホームはどちらも他の東西線の駅と同様、1面2線の島式ホームで、プラットホーム安全対策が設置されている。
sen.e: Just like platforms of other Tozai Line stations, these platforms are both double-track island platforms with safety barriers.
Like the platforms of other Tozai Line stations, these are both double-track islands with safety barriers.
Like the platforms of other Tozai Line stations, these are both double-track islands with safety barriers.

sen.j: 4番線は、ホームの有効長は6両分であるが、ホームドアは4両分のみ設けられている。
sen.e: While the platform on the fourth line has the same effective length as the length of six train cars joined together, platform barrier doors are available only for four cars.
While the platform on the fourth line has an effective length equal to six train cars, the platform barrier doors are available only for four cars.
While the Platform 4 has an effective length equal to six train cars, the platform barrier doors are available only for four cars.
sen.cmt: 表現を変更しました。Platform four→Platform 4に変更しました。

sen.j: 東西線の駅は駅ごとにステーションカラーが制定されているが、御陵駅のステーションカラーは桔梗色。
sen.e: Each station on the Tozai Line is assigned a unique station color; the color of Misasagi Station is deep purple.
Each station on the Tozai Line is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Misasagi Station is deep purple.
Each station on the Tozai Line is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Misasagi Station is deep purple.

sen.j: エレベーターは日立製。
sen.e: Elevators at the station are all made by Hitachi.
The station's elevators were all made by Hitachi.
The station's elevators were all made by Hitachi.

sen.j: のりば
sen.e: Platforms
Platforms
Platforms

sen.j: 奇数番線が六地蔵方面発着の列車用、偶数番線が京津線乗り入れ列車用となっている。
sen.e: Odd-numbered lines are for trains bound for Rokujizo Station, while even-numbered lines are for trains joining the Keishin Line.
Odd-numbered lines are for trains bound for Rokujizo Station, while even-numbered lines are for trains joining the Keishin Line.
Odd-numbered platforms are for trains bound for Rokujizo Station, while even-numbered platforms are for trains joining the Keishin Line.

sen.j: 大晦日などに、御陵～浜大津間の臨時列車が運転される時には、2番乗り場から折り返し運転の浜大津行きが発車する。
sen.e: When special trains are run between Misasagi and Hamaotsu Stations on occasions like New Year's Eve, shuttle trains for Hamaotsu leave the second platform.
When special trains are run between Misasagi and Hamaotsu Stations on occasions such as New Year's Eve, shuttle trains for Hamaotsu leave the second platform.
When special trains are run between Misasagi and Hamaotsu Stations on occasions such as New Year's Eve, shuttle trains for Hamaotsu leave Platoform 2.

sen.j: 駅は山科盆地の北西に位置し、三条通（府道四ノ宮四ツ塚線）の地下にある。
sen.e: The station, located in the north-western part of Yamashina Basin, is beneath Sanjo-dori Street (Kyoto Shinomiya Yotsuzuka Road).
The station, located in the northwestern part of the Yamashina Basin, is beneath Sanjo-dori Street (Kyoto Shinomiya Yotsuzuka Road).
The station, located in the northwestern part of the Yamashina Basin, is beneath Sanjo-dori Street (Shinomiya Yotsuzuka Line of Kyoto Prefectural Route).
sen.cmt: 道路表記を変更しました。

sen.j: 三条通はここから北西に進んで東山を越え、旧東海道の起点、三条大橋に至る。
sen.e: Sanjo-dori Street runs northwest from this location beyond Mt. Higashiyama all the way to the Sanjo-Ohashi Bridge, the starting point of the former Tokaido.
Sanjo-dori Street runs northwest from this location beyond Mt. Higashiyama, all the way to the Sanjo-Ohashi Bridge, the starting point of the former Tokaido.
Sanjo-dori Street runs northwest from this location beyond Mt. Higashiyama, all the way to the Sanjo-Ohashi Bridge, the starting point of the former Tokaido Road.

sen.j: 周囲は主に住宅地。
sen.e: Areas around the station are mostly residential districts.
The area surrounding the station is generally residential.
The area surrounding the station is generally residential.

sen.j: また住宅地北側の山麓を琵琶湖疏水が通る。
sen.e: The Lake Biwa Canal runs along the foot of the mountain located on the north of these residential districts.
Lake Biwa Canal runs along the foot of the mountain located north of these residential districts.
Lake Biwa Canal runs along the foot of the mountain located north of these residential districts.

sen.j: 駅施設は第三セクターである京都高速鉄道株式会社が建設。
sen.e: Misasagi Station was built by a third-sector company named Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 京都高速鉄道株式会社→Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co.,Ltd.[以下のサイトを参照しました。http://www.kurogane-rail.jp/shiryo/rail_corp.html]
sen.e: Misasagi Station was built by a third-sector company called Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd.
Misasagi Station was built by a third-sector company called Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: （詳しくは京都市営地下鉄東西線歴史を参照）
sen.e: (See the article about the history of Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line for details.)
(For details, see the article on the history of the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line.)
(For details, see the article on the history of the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line.)

sen.j: 京阪京津線との接続のため「4線シールド工法」という技法で工事が行われた。
sen.e: The station was built using a construction method known as the "four-line shield construction method" in order to establish a connection with the Keihan Keishin Line.
The station was built using a construction method known as the "four-line shield construction method" in order to establish a connection with the Keihan Keishin Line.
The station was built using a construction method known as the 'four-line shield construction method' in order to establish a connection with the Keihan Keishin Line.

sen.j: なお、京都市営地下鉄東西線開通前は京阪電気鉄道単独の地上駅として日ノ岡、御陵の2駅があり、現在の御陵駅はそれを統合した駅である。
sen.e: Before the opening of the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line, there were two ground stations (Hinooka and Misasagi) operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, which were integrated into the current Misasagi Station.

Prior to the opening of the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line, two ground stations (Hinooka and Misasagi) were operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, but eventually they were integrated into the current Misasagi Station.

Prior to the opening of the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line, two ground stations (Hinooka and Misasagi) were operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, but eventually they were integrated into the current Misasagi Station.

sen.j: また、駅（改札、ホーム）の位置は旧御陵駅と旧日ノ岡駅の中間に位置している。
sen.e: The current station (ticket gates and platforms) is located between the former Misasagi and Hinooka Stations.
The current station (ticket gates and platforms) is located between the former Misasagi and Hinooka stations.
The current station (ticket gates and platforms) is located between the former Misasagi and Hinooka stations.

sen.j: そのため、両駅の利用者への利便性に配慮するために地下鉄構内への入り口を旧日ノ岡駅側と旧御陵駅側に2箇所ずつ設けているが、いずれにしても改札までかなりの距離を歩かなければならないため不便であることに変わりがない。
sen.e: Consequently, although there are two entrances to the underground platforms on each side of the station (toward the former Hinooka Station and toward the former Misasagi Station) for the convenience of station users, it is a long walk from any of these entrances to the ticket gates, causing considerable inconvenience to users.

Consequently, although there are two entrances to the underground platforms on each side of the station (toward the former Hinooka and Misasagi stations) for the convenience of station users, it is a long walk from any of these entrances to the ticket gates, thus causing considerable inconvenience to users.

Consequently, although there are two entrances to the underground platforms on each side of the station (toward the former Hinooka and Misasagi stations) for the convenience of station users, it is a long walk from any of these entrances to the ticket gates, thus causing considerable inconvenience to users.

sen.j: 1912年8月15日 - 京津電気軌道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station was opened as a Keishin Denki Kido station on August 15, 1912,
The station was opened as a Keishin Denki Kido facility on August 15, 1912.
August 15, 1912: The station was opened as a Keishin Denki Kido facility.

sen.j: 1925年2月1日 - 会社合併により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On February 1, 1925, the station became a Keihan Electric Railway station as a result of a merger.
On February 1, 1925, the station became a Keihan Electric Railway facility due to a merger.
February 1, 1925: The station became a Keihan Electric Railway facility as a result of amalgamation.
sen.cmt: 会社合併→as a result of amalgamation として統一しました。

sen.j: 1943年10月1日 - 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1943, it became a Keihanshin Express Railway station as a result of another merger.
On October 1, 1943, it became a Keihanshin Express Railway station as a result of another merger.
October 1, 1943: It became a Keihanshin Express Railway station as a result of another amalgamation.
sen.cmt: 会社合併→as a result of amalgamation として統一しました。

sen.j: 1949年12月1日 - 会社分離により再び京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On December 1, 1949, the station became a Keihan Electric Railway station again as a result of the split-up of the railway company.
On December 1, 1949, the station became a Keihan Electric Railway station again as a result of the split-up of the railway company.
December 1, 1949: The station became a Keihan Electric Railway station again as a result of the split-up of the railway company.

sen.j: 1997年10月12日 - 京都市営地下鉄東西線開通に伴う地下駅開業に伴い、京阪京津線も同一ホームからの発着に変更され、従来の地上駅は廃止となる。
sen.e: On October 12, 1997, as a result of the opening of the underground station for the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line, rearrangements were made to train operations so that trains running on the Keihan Keishin Line could also be made to arrive at and depart from the same platforms, thereby causing the closure of the ground station.

On October 12, 1997, as a result of the opening of the underground station for the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line, rearrangements were made to train operations so that trains running on the Keihan Keishin Line could also be made to arrive at and depart from the same platforms, thereby causing the closure of the ground station.

October 12, 1997: As a result of the opening of the underground station for the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line, rearrangements were made to train operations so that trains running on the Keihan Keishin Line could also be made to arrive at and depart from the same platforms, thereby causing the closure of the ground station.

sen.j: 市営地下鉄と京阪電車の乗り換え（乗り入れ）駅であることから、東西線開通後しばらくの間、行先案内のためにそれぞれのホーム階に駅員が配置された。
sen.e: Since the new station was a transfer (junction) station between the City Subway Line and the Keihan Railway Line, station employees were allocated to respective platforms to provide guidance for users during a brief period of time after the opening of the Tozai Line.

Because the new station was a transfer (junction) station between the City Subway Line and the Keihan Railway Line, station employees were allocated to the respective platforms in order to provide guidance for users during a brief period of time after the opening of the Tozai Line.

Because the new station was a transfer (junction) station between the Municipal Subway Line and the Keihan Railway Line, station employees were allocated to the respective platforms in order to provide guidance for users during a brief period of time after the opening of the Tozai Line.

sen.j: 2007年4月1日 - PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards started to be used.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards became available.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa cards came into use.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

tit.j: 京津線 御陵駅（廃駅）

sen.j: 1997年10月11日まで地上に設置されていた駅である。
sen.e: This station was a ground station which was in operation until October 11, 1997.
This station was a ground facility that was in operation until October 11, 1997.
This station was a ground facility that was in operation until October 11, 1997.

sen.j: 停車する電車はいずれも2両編成の普通列車と準急の2種である。
sen.e: Trains that stopped at this station were local trains or sub-express trains, both of which were composed of two cars.
Trains that stopped at this station were local trains or sub-express trains, all of which were composed of two cars.
Trains that stopped at this station were local trains or sub-express trains, all of which were composed of two cars.

sen.j: （1981年に急行が廃止されるまでは、急行が停車していた。)
sen.e: (Before the express train service was discontinued in 1981, express trains stopped at this station.)
(Before the express train service was discontinued in 1981, express trains stopped at this station.)
(Before the express train service was discontinued in 1981, express trains stopped at this station.)

sen.j: 京津三条駅発の準急が最初に停車する駅である。
sen.e: It was the first station a sub-express train from Keishin-Sanjo Station stopped at.
It was the first station at which a sub-express train from Keishin-Sanjo Station stopped.
It was the first station at which a sub-express train from Keishin-Sanjo Station stopped.

sen.j: （京阪京津線1997年10月11日までの運行形態の項を参照。)
sen.e: (See the article concerning the train operations on the Keihan Keishin Line before October 11, 1997.)
(See the article concerning train operations on the Keihan Keishin Line before October 11, 1997.)
(See the article concerning train operations on the Keihan Keishin Line before October 11, 1997.)

sen.j: 浜大津駅発の準急が京津三条駅（終点）到着前に停車する最後の駅である。
sen.e: It was the last station that a sub-express from Hamaotsu Station stopped at before arriving at Keishin-Sanjo Station (terminal).
It was the last station at which a sub-express from Hamaotsu Station stopped before arriving at Keishin-Sanjo Station (terminal).
It was the last station at which a sub-express from Hamaotsu Station stopped before arriving at Keishin-Sanjo Station (terminal).

sen.j: （同上）
sen.e: (Same as the above)
(Same as the above)
(Same as the above)

sen.j: ホームの北側と南側は地形の問題もあり完全な対面式ではなく、北側（山科・浜大津行き）のホームは山科・四宮駅寄り、南側（京津三条行き）は京津三条駅寄りとずれた形で設置されていた。
sen.e: Due to the geography of the area, the platforms on the northern and southern sides were not designed to exactly face each other, with the northern platform (for trains bound for Yamashina and Hamaotsu) slightly shifted toward Yamashina Shinomiya Station and the southern platform (for trains bound for Keishin-Sanjo) toward Keishin-Sanjo Station.

Given the geography of the area, the platforms on the northern and southern sides weren't designed to exactly face each other; instead, the northern platform (for trains bound for Yamashina and Hamaotsu) was located slightly toward Yamashina Shinomiya Station and the southern platform (for trains bound for Keishin-Sanjo) was located toward Keishin-Sanjo Station.

Given the geography of the area, the platforms on the northern and southern sides weren't designed to exactly face each other; instead, the northern platform (for trains bound for Yamashina and Hamaotsu) was located slightly toward Yamashina and Shinomiya stations and the southern platform (for trains bound for Keishin-Sanjo) was located toward Keishin-Sanjo Station.
sen.cmt: 山科駅と四宮駅 のような表現にしました。

sen.j: それぞれのホーム入り口には券売機が1台設置されていた。
sen.e: A ticket vending machine was installed at the entrance to each platform.
A ticket vending machine was installed at the entrance to each platform.
A ticket vending machine was installed at the entrance to each platform.

sen.j: 南北のホームの間に踏み切り（渡り線）が設置されていた。
sen.e: There was a crossing (crossover) between the southern and northern platforms.
There was a crossing (crossover) between the southern and northern platforms.
There was a crossing (crossover) between the southern and northern platforms.

sen.j: 時期は不明だが券売機設置以前は切符販売員がいた。
sen.e: Before the ticket vending machines were installed, there was a period (exact dates unknown) when there were ticket sellers at the station (there are testimonies that these ticket sellers were old women recruited from nearby areas).

Before the ticket vending machines were installed, there was a period (exact dates unknown) when there were ticket sellers at the station (it is said that these ticket sellers were elderly women recruited from nearby areas).
Before the ticket vending machines were installed, there was a period (exact dates unknown) when there were ticket sellers at the station.
sen.cmt: 原文の範囲の英訳にしました。

sen.j: （近所の高齢女性であったという証言がある。)
sen.e: (it is said that these ticket sellers were elderly women recruited from nearby areas).
sen.cmt: 原文の範囲の英訳にしました。

sen.j: 現在は駅舎を含むホーム全てが解体され、遊歩道（駅跡付近から旧御陵府道踏み切りまでの区間）として整備されている。
sen.e: At present, the entire platforms, including the station building, have been demolished to be replaced by a walk way (from the former site of the station to the former Misasagi Prefectural Road).
Currently, all platforms, including the station building, have been demolished in order to be replaced by a walkway (from the former site of the station to the former Misasagi Prefectural Road).
Currently, all platforms, including the station building, have been demolished in order to be replaced by a walkway (from the former site of the station to the former Misasagi Prefectural Route).
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。
